thread.title: QND pays tribute to its boys golf team
thread.title_full: QND pays tribute to its boys golf team

author: Ben Marth
title: QND pays tribute to its boys golf team
text:
QND pays tribute to its boys golf team Posted: bmarth@wgem.com QND welcomed home its boys golf team with a pep rally Monday afternoon. 
QUINCY, Ill. (WGEM) -- Quincy Notre Dame paid tribute to its boys golf team with a pep rally Monday afternoon inside The Pit.The Raiders finished second at the state tournament in Bloomington and came home with their first trophy since 1998.A fitting end to what was a largely successful season."Unbelievable group of kids that bought in to what Coach (Mark) Longo and I were preaching to them," head coach Charles Scholz indicated."It was a total team effort all the down the lineup."Senior Drew Eaton finished second as an individual."I don't think it's really set in about how awesome it was to be on a team that finished second," Eaton explained."In a few years I'll look back on it and (say) 'Wow that was pretty cool.'"Senior William Eversman added: "No better way to go out. Sure we can say we wanted first (place) but any state trophy is amazing and it's a feeling that I'll never forget."Prior to the pep rally the Raiders were also treated to a fire truck ride through Quincy with stops at each of the catholic elementary schools.
